UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the PetConnect application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

profilePicture.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

bio.description: A short biography or description of the user.

definition.description: Stores user profile data, using the Firebase Auth UID as the document ID. Supports path-based ownership for simple security rules.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication and profile management for the PetConnect application. It prioritizes Authorization Independence by avoiding hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules. User profiles are stored in a dedicated collection (`users`) using their unique user ID as the document ID. This structure enables simple, path-based security rules for user profile access, ensuring only the authenticated user can read or write their own profile. This eliminates the need to denormalize any authorization data. The `users/{userId}` path structure naturally supports QAPs because list operations are inherently scoped to the user's own data. There are no global roles or collaborative data requirements.
